title: Is Donald Trump a superstar? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: He’s a failed businessman who mistakenly was “given” the job of President despite losing the popular vote by nearly THREE million. Doom on the Electoral College for not following their most basic premise - to prevent an idiot like Trump from getting into the White House. And notice how his rhetoric continues to spur mass shootings and murders. He’s a walking, talking POS who deserves to get his sorry behind THROWN out of Washington, and hopefully, out of the entire United States. Doom on him and all his minions.

Superstar, Definition: a person, as a performer or athlete, who enjoys wide recognition, is esteemed for exceptional talent, and is eagerly sought after for his or her services.2. any very prominent or successful person or thing. He is the President, which automatically gives him exposure and press attention. By the above definition, he is certainly a superstar to his base, who fawn over him endlessly. To his base, he fits the definition perfectly. On the other hand, there is sizable portion of citizens (probably a majority, according to polls) who are less than enamored or transfixed by Trump. To them, he’s hardly a superstar, and is not “esteemed for exceptional talent,” is not “sought ofter for his or her services,” and is not “successful.” So it all depends on perspective. The two sides will argue endlessly and to no meaningful end or purpose, as to his “superstar” status.
